id: Cancer surpasses heart disease as leading cause of death in many US counties
paragraph: Set edition preference:Set edition preference:Set edition preference:By Susan Scutti, CNNUpdated 5:03 PM ET, Mon November 12, 2018 Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds. (CNN)An important transition is happening across the United States: Cancer was the leading cause of death in more counties in 2015 than 13 years earlier, a new study finds. However, the opposite was true for heart disease during that period; fewer counties reported it as the top killer.Sign up here to get The Results Are In with Dr. Sanjay Gupta every Tuesday from the CNN Health team.
